page.title: 02CATTS PLACE AND PADDOCK WOOD
page.content: Catts Place, Paddock Wood This property was mentioned in the original Domesday Book Catts place was given to one Hugo de Catt by one of the monarchs, and is still in the ownership of descendants of the original family on the distaff side. The house has not really been altered much although bathrooms have been added There is about 16 acres of land with the house Wayside Cottage Originally a farm cottage dating from 1700 but has been added to and modernised over the years and now has a Granny Annexe It stands in 3 acres of land
